content: oma s sokken 2 0 so many of you have enjoyed knitting the original version of this pattern oma s sokken and i wanted to share this variation which has been my go-to sock pattern lately this version has no cuff but is knit in ribbing from the top down and results in a super snug and cozy sock i hope you ll enjoy knitting this version too size approx foot circumference yarn adult small medium large approximately 100g of fingering weight merino nylon blend yarn 7½ inches or 19 cm 8½ inches or 22 cm 9½ inches or notions 24 cm tapestry needle stitch marker s needles gauge 2 25 mm or us 1 double pointed needles 32 stitches = approx 10 cm unblocked set of 5 or your preferred needles for knitting in the round or on 2 circular needles ___________________________________________________________________________ the pattern is written to be knit with dpns but can be adapted for knitting in the round or with 2 circular needles magic loop if that s your preferred method if you re knitting socks for the first time you may find knitting on circular needles the easiest especially if you have some experience knitting in the round no matter which method you use it may be helpful to place a stitch marker or progress keeper to mark the beginning of your round you can also place stitch markers after every 14 16 18 stitches to mimic the 4 needles referenced in this pattern note there is no further mention of stitch markers in this pattern so if you use them just slip them from needle to needle as you go along ready to cast on let s go cast on 56 64 72 stitches using the long tail cast on method distribute evenly on 4 needles you should have 14 16 18 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches there is no cuff in this version of oma s sokken you will start knitting the ribbed leg of the sock right away round 1 *k3 p1* repeat to the end of the round repeat round 1 until you reach your desired leg length you can knit knee socks ankle socks or somewhere in between just be sure you have enough yarn you should be able to knit 2 adult medium knee socks with 100 g of fingering weight yarn now you re ready to start on the heel portion of the sock there are many different types of heels you can knit for a sock i find the following traditional heel flap and gusset the best fit for my family but feel free to substitute any other heel you like the heel flap and heel turn are worked flat in other words not in the round heel flap set up knit across the n1 and n2 in the rib pattern k3 p1 these will be the front of the sock or instep and these stitches
